title: How to Make Mini Maple Pancake Muffins

steps.headline: Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar in a medium bowl.
Combine the buttermilk, egg, maple syrup, and melted butter in a separate medium bowl.
Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients bowl.
Fold the chocolate chips into the batter.
Use non-stick cooking spray on a mini muffin pan.
Pour the batter into each slot.
steps.description: Fill each of them 2/3 full, but if you wish to have bigger "muffins", you can also fill it to the line.

steps.headline: Bake for 8-10 minutes.
steps.description: Check completeness with a toothpick. If the toothpick has batter remains or the tops of the pancakes looks "gooey", return the pan to the oven for an additional minute. If the toothpick comes out clean and the tops look crisp, they are done.

steps.headline: Set to cool.
steps.description: Remove from the pan and let cool on a cooling rack or plate.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy with a generous amount of maple syrup.

text: Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).  Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar in a medium bowl.  Combine the buttermilk, egg, maple syrup, and melted butter in a separate medium bowl.  Stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients bowl. Make sure to mix thoroughly. Fold the chocolate chips into the batter.  Use non-stick cooking spray on a mini muffin pan.  Pour the batter into each slot. Fill each of them 2/3 full, but if you wish to have bigger "muffins", you can also fill it to the line. Bake for 8-10 minutes. Check completeness with a toothpick. If the toothpick has batter remains or the tops of the pancakes looks "gooey", return the pan to the oven for an additional minute. If the toothpick comes out clean and the tops look crisp, they are done. Set to cool. Remove from the pan and let cool on a cooling rack or plate. Serve and enjoy with a generous amount of maple syrup.
